Texts.Text: A bit of signage to cheaply embellish your city.
A few signs and paving variations.
All you need to design a small plaza in your city.
A very elegant pack of mosaics and colonnades for a beautiful esplanade.
The latest creation to bring clean water to your city with a flourish.
Columns and channels to match the ancient style.
A couple of unique buildings for the gates of your city.
A few aesthetic additions for the water features of your city.
Buildings and pavillions to create a beautiful annexe for your World's Fair.
Mostly mechanical tools of little value.
First-hand equipment to reinforce your buildings and production.
Low quality seeds that still ensure your crops grow where you desire them to.
Some advanced technology to enhance your production.
The product of the latest research in chemistry.
The best tools and structures to reinforce your production.
A selection of newly designed machines that use electricity to achieve miracles.
All you need for a very efficient and modern farming industry.
The latest inventions of the most talented engineers of the era.
A few old possessions and statues of little value.
The spartan possessions of an ancient warrior.
The remains of a modest tomb.
Old writings, some of which are now of great value.
Some remains that once belonged to a wealthy person.
Funerary textiles buried with a noble in her tomb.
A pack of bones from creatures long gone.
Legendary artifacts that no one thought could be real.
The remains of the greatest constructions of the past.
The wild and rampant species of grassy field.
A collection of trees from across all continents.
Grown in water, fully or partially.
Half trees, half flower, but wholly beautiful.
A fine set of colourful and perfumed flowers.
Rare flowers and plants from the tropics.
Plants both giant and striking in appearance.
Plants known only in myths. Could they be real after all?
Long-ranged echo-locator that reveals nearby quest objectives, treasures, and mines.
Sound out even the most sunken of sunken treasures with this subsurface detector — an innovation in sea surveying far ahead of its time.
A Few Screws Short Of A Toolshed
Medium-ranged echo-locator that reveals nearby quest objectives, treasures, and mines.
An improved version of Old Nate's echo-ranger, with more bells and whistles.
Short-ranged echo-locator that reveals nearby quest objectives, treasures, and mines.
Old Nate's first attempt at mapping the depths using sound.
Allows the ship to attack without need of a state of war in diplomacy.
In the Name of the Father 4 — The Steward
Your buildings and ships repair themselves even during combat.
All your crew needs to repair modern ships in battle.

Ernest Poppinjay based his system for moving ship repair tools on the dumb waiter that brought him breakfast.
Map of Old Nate's Prototype Airship Crash Site (The Arctic)
The Floating City — A Hulking Shell
An abundance of repair tools on wheels, to help keep your ship in shape.
Contains an abundance of useful repair tools.
The Executioner's Mask 2 — Error of Judgement
An exceptional design that gives your steamship an extra bit of oomph when it needs it the most.
In Love With The Devil 1 — Bride-To-Be
A Diplomatic Minefield 3 — Crossing The Rubicon
A game of cat and mouse

Me Old Mum — A Taste of Their Own Medicine
Me Old Mum — A Man Needs a Mum

The Prestige 1 — They Do It With Mirrors
They linger high and vivid in the night sky.
Nine Lives 2 — Land On Your Feet
Nine Lives 3 — The Ninth Life of the Cat
Ship Drop - Carl Leonard von Malching
Going up in Smoke 2 — Ship to Ship
A Man of Noble Intentions 3 — Obligate Noblesse

A Man of Noble Intentions 1 — Sweet Talk
Hostile Takeover - Carl Leonard von Malching
In the Name of the Father 2 — The Blind Eye
In the Name of the Father 5 — The Daughters
Very good at putting out fires.
The Promise Trust 3 — Ready to Influence
The Promise Trust 4 — The Finishing Touches
The Promise Trust 1 — The Main Event
A marvellous and most modern vapouriser!
A cocktail from your kitchen cupboard.
That'll stop them foaming at the mouth!
All Old and New World Residences, except Scholar Residences
Its secret was a mouldy petri dish!
Lets ships spit flames, setting their enemies ablaze.
The sinister flame-projecting machine of a fire-worshipping cult. Handle with care, in case their zeal is contagious.
A frightening innovation that breathes fire upon the enemy.
In Love With The Devil 4 — An Uninvited Guest
In Love With The Devil 5 — Mr. Bingles' Bungle
Moral Panic 3 — The Scales of Anubis
Moral Panic 4 — Rock and a Hard Place
Fires a fast projectile in a straight line that explodes on impact.
Mäuser's heavy siege howitzer is designed for attacking the very latest ships and naval fortifications.
Its smoking barrel smells of campaign and conquest.
Gives the cabin boy something to fire!
Fires a barrage of 5 projectiles in an arc, with each exploding on impact.
Leaves the enemy feeling utterly mortified!
Fires a projectile in an arc that explodes on impact.
Hook's devastating mortar bombards your enemies from above with myriad explosive shells.
Bombards your enemies from above with explosive shells.
Does a little pivot before firing.
Shoots a torpedo that explodes on target location.

Bluehead's avant-garde torpedo will revolutionise your naval offensive with its compressed air underwater propelling and its precise explosive warhead thanks to its gyroscopic course-correction system.
Effective as ever, these mortars can be mounted onto your ship to bombard your enemies from above with explosive shells.
To fish, throw dynamite into the sea with a left-click.
An explosive gift from Aarhant's emergency supplies.
Places a mine below the surface that explodes on enemy proximity.
A mine of monstrous size and ferocity, whose horns really hertz. Look close, and you can see steam puffing from its wetted nostrils.
Bigger and prongier. Adds a bit of froth and fizz to the mix whenever its destructive services are called upon.
Blows up one in every ten passing ships (probably).
Only five star crude will pass this extractor's exacting selection process.
Gathers fossil goop the average sucker might miss.
Ensures not a drop goes to waste.
One of Old Nate's more down-to-earth inventions. Gathers precious metals at a remarkable rate.
A proper cropper of zinc and copper.
A sideline in copper and zinc.
This model is the gold standard. Simply pour black gold in and get gold gold out.
A bit of hip-wiggle in this iteration seems to attract even more gold.
Increases your prospects of striking gold.
Old Nate's most far-reaching scavenging dredge, designed to plumb the ocean's deepest trenches for sunken machinery.
A slightly more ambitious dredge of Old Nate's, designed to plumb deeper water for sunken machinery.
For scraping the bottom of the barrel.
Sifts a very large area of the seabed, revealing remarkable artifacts that incrustations have long kept concealed.
Sifts a large area of the seabed for obscure and ancient artifacts.
Sifts the seabed for ancient artifacts.
Nate stroked this monster magnet with his master magnet. Expect to find the ripest, rustiest junk going. Demagnetizes over time.
A big magnet that attracts the attention of some really great junk. Demagnetizes over time.
Dinky magnet that draws up dross. Demagnetizes over time.
Has the miraculous power to draw the most bizarre abyssal creatures in creation to the surface.
Brings scores of fascinating marine creatures to the surface.
This could be a (very) sudden solution to all the problems of capitalism.
No Gods, No Masters 2 — An Eye for an Eye
No Gods, No Masters 3 — Trust Issues
Looks like Cinderella better think twice about going to that ball...
Not so keen on cocktails now, are they!? Hehehee.
Accidents happen, and your toffs know it.
Only the invisible pilots steering a course to anarchy can avoid collisions with these invisible terrors!
It's only a matter of time before great change erupts!
Discharges a bomb that explodes after a short delay.
Big enough to bring the house of the Royal Council down — just don't fluff it, or they'll be celebrating your failure forever.
If for any reason the books and pamphlets aren't working...
Dr. Mercier's Feverishly Federating Flag of the Free
Upon seeing Dr. Mercier's flag flapping from your ships, there is every chance of the enemy hopping on to your bandwagon…
I'm here on Her Majesty's business!
The ship shoots special chain projectiles, severely slowing the enemy.
A man walks into a bar.... Ouch.
Fires an incendiary projectile that spreads fire on impact.
Your ship will explode in 10 seconds, dealing area damage to enemies based on your ship's hitpoints.
Prevents the ship from getting attacked, but also prevents it attacking.
And it gets you good deals as well...
Overwhelms the enemy with attacks, slowing their movement and attack speed.
Launches a torpedo that explodes upon reaching the target.
Its path remains true, no matter the weather.
The end of the revolution party!
Coral reefs: the rainforests of the sea.
Shelter, hunting ground, nursery: to a fish, coral is essential.
Fish need coral like birds need trees.
Bring nature to the urban centre.
Green discs sitting happily on the surface.
Turn the feeblest calf into the sturdiest bull!
All the nutrients a plant could ever ask for.
Even plants are taking dietary supplements these days.
Don't ask where it comes from.
Reuse: it's the way of the future!
Few envy his detailed knowledge of animal excreta.
Always trying to provoke a reaction.
Botany is as much an art as a science.
From struggling saplings to towering giants, he cares for them all.
Knows more about photosynthetic eukaryotic organisms than you'll believe.
Among the rocks and reefs lie unexpected delicacies.
She's taken a look at your accounts, and she has a few suggestions...
The Pyrphorians knew a thing or two about industry.
Good work needs space to flourish.
Even the hardiest workers need time to rest.
If you want to take care of business, take care of the workers.
A masterwork on farming practices, inspired by the study of Mesoan techniques.
Tips and tricks for healthy soil.
We be fishing for flotsam today, lad.
There's an art to dealing with all this muck, don't you know?
Best not to stand too close.
Dirt, algae, microscopic mushrooms — all gone!
Belinda San Pedro, Head of Arcade Acquisitions
Belinda loves to people-watch — from the moment they step into the arcade to the moment they step out, she observes and takes note.
The Pit and The Pendulum 1 — Condemned
Greeting customers makes them feel seen ...especially if they leave without making a purchase.
Juvenile Detention (TBC - Quest not yet written)
Conflict of Interest (TBC - Quest not yet written)
Break Out (TBC - Quest not yet written)
Royal Inspection 2 — The Inspection (TBC - Quest not yet written)
Breakout sustain 2 (TBC - Quest not yet written)
Brekaout destory 3 (TBC - Quest not yet written)
His trick is to turn window-shoppers into proper shoppers.
Get Rich Quick Vol VIII: Backlogs On The Fire
Years of experience drip from Dr. Val Goldfall's latest volume, in which he pins down the perfect production schedule.
Get Rich Quick Vol IX: Paid To Perform
In his final book, published posthumously, Dr. Goldfall imagines a world in which people are paid not by the hour, but by results.
Get Rich Quick Vol VII: Automation Nation
Instead of its usual workforce, the building employs Engineer Workforce.
In the seventh volume of his acclaimed business series, Dr. Val Goldfall argues that all humans can essentially be fed code.
Get Rich Quick Vol VI: Night Moves
"Business at night runs as smooth as passing ships,"— Val Goldfall, a man with the midas touch.
Get Rich Quick Vol V: The Geppetto Gambit
Fresh from a prolific career in high-yield farming ventures, Dr. Val Goldfall casts a sharp eye over the enduring power of fine craftsmanship.
A Colossal Pain 2 — A Vision In Plaster
A Colossal Pain 5 — The Grand Unveiling
Portrait of the Artist as an Old Man 2 — Art Thieves
Portrait of the Artist as an Old Man 3 — Auction
Portrait of the Artist as an Old Man 1 — The Artist
Get Rich Quick Vol IV: The Wasteland
"Goldfall's agronomic poetry never ceases to amaze — it seems now muck is gold!" — Yate Swindell, Farmboy Weekly.
Get Rich Quick Vol III: Pretty Polyculture
The best-selling series from veteran businessman Dr. Val Goldfall continues with this look at profiting from diversified garden eco-systems.
Get Rich Quick Vol II: What Shape is a Banana Anyway?
Dr. Val Goldfall shares all the tricks of the trade when it comes to bypassing the rules and regs of selling damaged or mis-shapen fruit and veg.
Get Rich Quick Vol I: Pestilential Profit
Dr. Val Goldfall charts his success, showing how a simple pest control scheme saved the harvest for millions of happy customers.
A certificate issued by the Galeria Baderette rewarding the avoidance of complete failure. It might inspire your workers to strive for similar recognition.
An honorary certificate issued by the Galeria Baderette rewarding endeavour in finishing a task on time. It may inspire your workers to strive for similar recognition.
A special certificate issued by the Galeria Baderette rewarding outstanding commitment to finishing a task faster than demanded. It may inspire your workers to strive for similar recognition.
“Sir, an extra side of fries with the fish?”
Every chef needs a capable second.
As ruler of the kitchen kingdom, she knows there’s much more to fine cooking than good taste alone.
Higher costs mean higher safety. If a machine fails, there’s always a backup.
Emulating Mother Nature’s delicate touch will yield a plentiful harvest.
From a single stem grows a multitude of produce.
Receives radio and telephone signals and rebroadcasts them without any loss of quality.
A high-vacuum tube amplifier that counters the attenuation of vocal signals.
Can safely stitch a sole in thirty seconds, no less. The company that produced it has vanished into the aether.
Punches thousands of staring eyeholes in leather.
A smooth wooden foot to lay shoe patterns on.
Saves time by adhering a suit's inner lining to the outer by heat and pressure. Blotherhithe fears needles, you see.
This adjustable mannequin allows the tailor to continue working on the suit while the customer sits idly at home.
A drum so large it requires four horse-drawn carts to move it, and when it is beaten can be heard fifty miles away!
Pyrphorian Penance — Vengeance Is Still Futile
A Prince In Progress — Father Figure
A Prince In Progress — Princely Virtue
A Prince In Progress — The Tutor
An Enbesan luthier's dream: the lyre-like krar produces rich and textured melodies.
For ceremonial use in the Enbesan Highlands. Made from a hollowed out tree trunk.
My Lord Is My Shepherd — Amun
My Lord Is My Shepherd — Holy Fire
Draws energy from the impulse of moving water, not water's dead weight like a typical water wheel.
An extra water wheel to zhuzh up your river production.
Sprightly old Mrs Yebeba added transparency to the whole debate around how to help crops grow well-nourished and undisturbed.
I'm sure your soul has room for one.
Seafood happily parades into the late captain's trusty trap, which kept him alive for five long years stranded out in the deep blue.
Even a sharp pair of claws seldom makes its way out.
Map of a Lost Shepherds' Camp (Enbesa)
A recent introduction of Ketema's to northern Enbesa means no more firing the clay under eucalyptus leaves for hours on end.
An alternative to the painstaking and personal approach Enbesans traditionally take to shaping clay.
Almost an afterthought of Biniam's, this floodgate allows full control of your canals, allowing them to reach their greatest range.
A sluice gate to make the most of the available water so that it can go further.
A small stop gate to have a bit of control over where water goes and when.
The rotary blade is capable of slicing strips of sanga in the bat of an eyelash — and as thin as an eyelash too.
Vastly speeds up the drying process.
A medium-sized guillotine that makes meat slicing a lot faster.
Beekeepers speak honeyed words over the Queenby's patented air-seal that ensures their epidermal safety.
This smoker blows soothing smoke among the bees, making human interaction with the hive easier and safer.
An automated system of needles and levers — simply feed in pages, and watch as it does the rest.
Keeps big stacks of paper in alignment as they are sewn together.
A kit of book-binding tools, to achieve the traditional Enbesan book-binding look by hand.
The ultimate arbiter of men's fashion, and a complete and utter bore about it, for every would-be-dandy craves his advice.
Most people say Poiret is style over substance, but boy, oh boy, were the rubber tyres on his last piece hefty.
Really does spend a very long time taking measurements, but all your uppity friends say it's worth it.
Forged in the fires of years of flame-fighting in Enbesa. An expert in all things fire-related.
A hero among fishermen — and apparently he doesn't even need to wear the costume!
A provider of saline solutions, this fellow always washes up with a glass of water to hand.
His liturgical music has wide popularity among elders, who exert extra effort to hit all the high notes.
The manipulation of punchy, many-coloured powders is an art hidden from view under bright canopies.
It is actually possible to make pulpwood from wanza, although to the expert eye it may appear a little stiff.
Instead of its usual workforce, the building employs Shepherd Workforce.
Magan's family migrated across the warm ocean from a land of towering temples, and elephants with smaller ears.
Craftsmen earn respect in Enbesa, just like this man has.
Breaking from the teachings of his peers on Kidusi, the bishop believes the church must move with the times.
Spent his childhood on Kidusi reading about traditional Enbesan food, but today it's the twist he brings that makes him a star.
"Flaxseed Tea is really delicious with a drop of honey or a squeeze of lemon."
Calla Lily, Of The Desert Bloom
Having lived on dry Waha Desher for years, she knows how to spring beauty from inhospitable soil.
All Enbesan Crop Farms including Bees
Nobody understands her mumbles, but she knows her way around flowers.
Loves all four-hoofed beasts equally, save for his sheep Amun — his friend, companion and soulmate.
Always finds the best spots for her animals to graze peacefully.
Harvests gold and crops simultaneously. In the future we'll all be stupid rich, sitting on mountains of nuggets the size of potatoes!
Metals are sucked into the stratosphere, clinging to it, until finally it comes crashing back down to earth.
Doesn't matter what you pile into your cigar: tobacco, hay, dog hair, the weeds around pumpkins...
Produces a whirligig of soda and vegetable extract, which may become a popular alternative to coffee someday.
Old N8 was inspired to create one of these after one of his many trips to the Far East.
No time for the pub? Take a selection of sophisticated ales back to work with you in an artisanal carry-box.
Old N8 grew tired of having to go to an underground cave every time he needed rocks for his whiskey.
Flips and replaces shellac records automatically from a collection of popular music hall tunes.
Nate was vexed to find the yak milk butter in his larder had turned a rancid orange, and knew something must be done.
Old Nate tested the sensors by setting fire to his sleeve.
A chance for employees to soak up all the latest gossip.
Nate didn't have post office employees in mind when he came up with this scalding-hot coffee conveyor, yet they're lapping it up!
A mule so assiduous in its quest for gas, it is willing to pause only for copper and zinc.
A crisp and comforting exterior that masks a complex heating system within. Also offers deep storage options.
The little machine that can. N8 once canned a batch of horse meat with it to sell it in bulk as beef.
Spice, booze, a few twists of the handle, and winter no longer seems quite so cold.
Not only current, but futuristic too! Old N8's futuristic zapper carbonises logs so you don't have to.
With such squat and portly candles stomping off the production line, your lamps can go without brass.
Drop a thick walrus steak on the angry red bars, and watch the place sizzle up.
Irritate coworkers by cranking out the same tunes over and over and over again.
Naturally, he is aware that pemmican must be high in fat, but Sandro manages to put some excess to other uses.
In touch with the origins of pemmican, among the native peoples of the plains.
Has made pemmican many times before.
When trees are few and far between, you learn the places driftwood prefers to end its voyages.
Learned the craft from his father's father, who learned from his father before that.
Toklo respects his prey, taking only what he needs. Collects feathers from bird roosts.
She knows all the best spots, and breathes more quietly than an Arctic hare.
She knows that strong dogs make the best companions, and strong geese have the best feathers.
The geese and the dogs know him as their father.
The dogs and geese won't bite him any more.
Once the incomparable Arnarunn has knitted a superlative sleeping bag, it will never need replacing.
Knows all the patterns perfectly, and doesn't waste a scrap of the animal's skin.
An average Inuit seamster is likely the best seamster you've ever met.
Useful for smoothing wood surfaces in Arctic conditions, and extremely comfortable in the hand.
Useful for smoothing wood surfaces in Arctic conditions.
A decent tool for shaping wood in Arctic conditions.
For those who spend a lot of time out in the snow with the critters, and who wish to feel at one with them.
Snow goggles that are both comfortable and durable.
The Inuit store needles in these carry cases so they don't get blunted and are always close at hand.
Awls make holes for needles to pass through to prevent them from breaking.
Skins must first be treated, or clothes made from them will stiffen and rot.
Reaches the exact temperature required to kill bacteria prior to the curing process, but preserves the moisture in the meat.
A safety precaution to kill bacteria before curing. Now with improved temperature control.
A safety precaution to kill bacteria before curing.
This mighty bow from the north west is powerful enough to bring down a fully-grown moose.
The arrow flies higher and higher, further and further.
Soft and silent, the arrow buries itself.
The most effective tool for skinning seals, incorporating thousands of years of Inuit knowledge and practice.
An effective Inuit harpoon when sealing, says Qumaq.
So smooth in the water, the bowhead cannot hear you as you approach its shoreline bed. Poor whales.
Perfect for navigating narrow channels where whales come to sleep at night.
Sneak up on poor snoozing whales.
Susannah Brightwoman, A Glimmer In The Darkness
Joined after you helped the Queen at Trelawney. Formerly of the Royal Mint, the Queen sent Susannah to make your gold go further.
This unique hydroelectric generator has a gold plaque inscribed with its inventor's motto: "Consequences be dammed! Ha! — N8"
This advanced hydroelectric paddlewheel is immune to rust and corrosion, if not the odd explosion.
Clever use of water's potential energy to generate electricity.
These tricky lobster nippers could sneak mice out from their slippers, or tip some salted kippers on some drippy tallship skippers.
Grab even more with each fell swoop.
The enthusiast's choice. Old Nate neglected to include an operating manual, meaning there's a chance of the odd accident.
The persistent screech this extra-powerful contraption generates cannot be normal...
So the blue cable to the yellow pin... Oh wait... Or was it red?
The nearest thing Nate has to a companion. Unlike a human servant, it won't complain when he kicks it for setting things on fire.
Compensates for its faithfulness in performing simple human tasks by being wilfully blind.
Some say there's a tiny boy inside pulling the levers...
Old Nate's baby. Prone to the odd tantrum, but provides the lift everyone needs in times of logistical disconsolation.
A reinforced variant, which in spite of the minor combustion risk, takes all the labour out of warehouse work.
This unpredictable prototype was originally built to gain an unfair advantage at steam car races.
A man with an infectious, impetuous and impassioned urge for action.
An airy space, not at all empty, but brimming with ideas for economisation! Self-sufficiency; over-abundance! Those are the topics for discussion at this venue's very functional table.
The people need somewhere they feel comfortable sharing ideas to help economise during production!
The people own what they produce! They should be free to join a great queue to collect their quota!
The labour notes are now so beautifully typeset and presented, they really look like they're worth something! A sign of the wonders of anarchy to come!
A new and better printing machine helps distribute labour notes to workers at no maintenance cost!
Workers are enthused by the new system of written labour notes to reward their efforts.
Green's Law to Postpone The Apocalypse
Miss Green's clever measures to reduce smog can save our species from extinction!
The difference in the city air is like night and day.
Makes the city air cleaner at night.
"This is the era of industrialisation! To hell with the tree-hugging leaf-lickers!", declares Lord Footprint.
Don't let anybody stop you burning coal, even if it looks gruesome!
The world runs on money, not oxygen!
Better factory materials cost more money, but it's bound to be worth it in the end, argues Lord Fizgig.
An investment that provides your people with the ways and means to combat a blaze.
Von Malching fought hard at the council to ensure children might also enjoy supervisory roles in factories.
You can make everything on the cheap, and no-one has to know.
Makes it look like your premises are all above board.
These oysters have been adapted to grow in a very wide range of seas, and with an increased yield!
This spawn can help you grow a large colony of oysters in unfamiliar waters.
Welcome to the Truth 4 — The Answer
This spawn can help you grow a small colony of oysters in unfamiliar waters.
These saplings have been adapted to grow in a very wide range of soils, and with increased yield of plantain!
These saplings can help you grow plentiful plantain groves in alien soil.
These saplings can help you grow a few plantain groves in alien soil.
Are you feeling corny? Plant these selected corn seeds and soon you will be buried in mountains of sweet golden kernels!
If you are feeling corny, plant these seeds and watch them become a steady supply of shiny ears of corn.
If you are feeling corny, bring these mixed corn seeds with you to grow the golden tidbits.
Having trouble waking up without caffeine? Export the fragrant, delicious pungency of these selected coffee beans to put a toasted full stop on morning drowsiness.
Having trouble waking up without caffeine? Bring your population back to life with these coffee beans.
Having trouble waking up without caffeine? Take these coffee beans with you to never miss a cup.
Unable to bounce back without caoutchouc? Get tacky rivers of white gold flowing from these superior caoutchouc saplings!
Unable to bounce back without caoutchouc? These caoutchouc saplings will make the ductile material flow anywhere you plant them.
Unable to bounce back without caoutchouc? Bring these saplings of the sappy tree wherever you need it.
Cocoa cravings? You will not be able to stop nibbling on the exquisite beans these cacao beans will grow!
Cocoa cravings? Spread the joy of chocolate wherever you go with these cacao beans!
Cocoa cravings? Plant these raw cacao beans and get some nibs!
Dreams of fluffy clouds of cotton? Sow these selected cotton seeds and watch as heaven arises from the earth!
Dreams of clouds of cotton? Sleep tight after sowing these cotton seeds, for the fluffy results are certainly guaranteed.
Dreams of clouds of cotton? These mixed seeds have been proved to result in immaculate, if slightly meager, white fluff.
If you need a smoke, you are in luck, for you have never lighten up a higher quality leaf than the ones these seeds will sprout!
If you need a smoke, sow these and tobacco leaves will soon puff up as if they had been there all along!
If you need a smoke, these seeds should grow into average quality tobacco leaves.
Indulge everyone's sweet tooth! Let these premium sugar cane saplings colonise your fields and hearts with their delightful nectar!
Indulge your sweet tooth with these syrupy sugar saplings! Or plant them and get even more!
Indulge your sweet tooth! These sugar saplings might not be juiciest, though still better than saccharin!
Peppers don't ring a bell? The colossal, shiny, sweet bell peppers that will sprout from these seeds do merit for a more alluring name!
Peppers don't ring a bell? Wherever you plant these seeds, the tasty vegetable will crop up.
Peppers don't ring a bell? Some of these seeds will become the plump goodness soon enough. Then again, some won't.
O, for a draught of vintage! You have never seen plumper grapes than the ones that will soon heavy down these sturdy vines wherever you plant them!
O, for a draught of vintage! Give these vines a few days and it will be as if they had always grown there.
O, for a draught of vintage! These scrawny vines will yiled scrawny grapes, but scrawny grapes are better than no grapes at all!
A starchy problem? Export these high-quality potatoes anywhere you need and they will take solid roots!
A starchy problem? These sprouted potatoes will grow healthy as any endemic crop.
A starchy problem? Take these sprouted potatoes anywhere and they will grow a little.

Lafoensia acuminata. The bark of its stem is a proven panacea in traditional tonics of the rainforest.
Montastraea Cavernosa. Its lumpish colonies are likely to trigger trypophobes.
Victoria Amazonica. 'On unbent leaf, in fairy guise... stands Annie, Paxton's daughter.'
Espeletia schultzii. A montane yellow flower living the monastic life with the cacti up in the Páramo.
Eichhornia Crassipes. An extremely determined invader.
Ocimum tenuiflorum. Its aromatic purple leaves have religious and medicinal uses.
Armeria maritima. Its globes of pink flowers resemble balloons floating along coastal cliffs.
Acropora Cervicornis. A hard coral that reaches out like a tree.
Limonium perezii. They grow in saline soil, dappling coasts with violet corymbs.
Saxifraga Oppositifolia. Breaks out among rocks after the thaw.
Salvia pratensis. Covered in vivid indigo flowers, it's perfect for seasoning meats.
Rhododendron. A genus of bold-coloured shrubs so diverse, botanists can't agree on a taxonomy.
Dendrogyra cylindrus. Figures huddling in the water's gloom.
Cyperus Papyrus. Once used as paper, but also for boats, clothes, and even as food.
Roystonea regia. Its giant leaves magically detach in tropical storms.
Magnolia champaca. Its fragrant flowers may be used to adorn statues of Goddesses.
Nymphaea alba. Frequently accompanied by the croaking of toads.
Hevea Rigidifolia. A New World spurge producing resinous rubber.
Jasminum multiflorum. Unlike its common cousin, the flowers of this eastern star open in the winter.
Cocos nucifera. Make sure a falling drupe doesn't bonk you on the coco.
Prunus serrulata. Clouds of graceful blossom to drink and picnic beneath.
Convolvulus arvensis. A.k.a. 'field bindweed', which says it all really.
Abies Lasiocarpa. Grows near the timberline.
Phragmites australis. Whispers along the edges of estuaries.
Mentha balsamea. Leaves a fresh tingle on the tongue.
Papaver rhoeas. Bright red dots among the wheat.
Cannabis sativa. Weave it into anything — linen garments, rope, even candlewicks...
Digitalis purpurea. Chopping a spike of foxglove bells will spite the fairies.
Sambucus nigra. Home to hummingbirds and warblers.
Taraxacum officinale. Make a wish and blow its puffballs on their way.
Vaccinium myrtillus. Dyes the mouth a sweet, deep purple.
A tablet so mystifying it will convince the vast majority of museum visitors that Atlantis existed, while leaving true scholars of the ancient world pretty sceptical.
The Gates to Paititi (The New World)
The megalithic structure lends further credence to the existence of a lost continent to the west. Experts say this stepped pyramid could have been at the heart of Atlantean ritual.
A statue cut from a material so rare that for millennia it has been known only by its name. It is quite possible that this is the only example of this mineral that remains.
The Palaces of Baiea (The Old World)
No courthouse could bridle the hubris of the Atlanteans, and so it was left to the fates instead to condemn those peoples to the eternal abyss.
This sunken shrine to fork-wielding Poseidon seems ironic now. Why did Poseidon not save his children, when the oceans were his to command?
Evidence of a long-lost civilisation? They say the Kingdom of Atlantis spanned a vast and fertile continent that, according to legend, tragically subsided into the sea.
Nadasky's dying wish was that this medal be recovered for his young son, who dreamed of becoming an admiral like his father...
A remarkable figurehead belonging to a resplendent imperial ship that fought in the battle of Trelawney.
The great strategist's blade. Last seen held aloft and glinting in the southern sun, just before the fleet cut through the enemy line.
A medal belonging to a high-ranking officer, who may have died at Trelawney.
Map of a Forgotten Wreck (Cape Trelawney)
Latimeria chalumnae. Old Nate looks at you and says, "This isn't the only living fossil hanging around the sea bed".
The legendary Kraken, captured! It propels itself wildly around the tank! Tiny human observers cower under its mesmerising gaze!

Cyanea capillata. The rapunzel of the sea, this great hairy stinger can grow even longer than the blue whale!

Chiasmodon niger. Stuffs prey larger than itself into a stretchable cocoon-like basket that dangles from its belly.
Mitsukurina owstoni. Captures the imagination with its extensive proboscis, much like the mythical goblin Tengu.
Atractosteus spatula. The species has existed for more years than a person could count in their lifetime.

Watasenia scintillans. Very small, it uses counter-illumination to hide from predators, mimicking the surface water color.
Species Unrecorded. This species has not yet been categorised. Why not name it after yourself!
Stomiidae. Normally dwells deeper than even submersibles can reach, but was caught when coming to the surface for oxygen.
Periphylla periphylla. Avoids the light, as with so many of us these days.
Psychrolutes marcidus. A melted human face with fins.
Merely opening this occult tome makes those nearby uncomfortable. Apparently, the whole thing came to its author in a waking dream; such is his deep, dark and perturbing talent.
From the head of someone who chooses the worthy among the slain.

Don't mistake its fin for a shark's.

The songs of those who held this tabot long ago still echo through the fragile wood. Fine etchings line the contours: 'Verse 2. For what is the beauty of day without the coming of the night? To those who pray in the comfort of day, the Lord brings solace, but to those who pray in the fading of dusk will enlightenment be provisioned!'

An inner light shines quietly from the sheltered cusp, a sparkle of the splendour of the Gardens of Sile'Amidos. Fine etchings cover the lid: 'Verse 3. Fear not the mountain, but come to it with love. For in that barrow do the Elder Days still reside, in the splendour of their Great Majesty. For those who begin in the cool of the humble shadow, light will show the way.'
A temple dedicated to the peerless Deltan queen Nafir, decorated with colossi and Deltan art.
Brought to Enbesa by Queen Shaba, proof that the lineage of Enbesan emperors can be traced back to King Selamawi.

The legendary spear of Enbesa's Elamais lineage. Its neck, carved with etchings, is said to be an authentic part of the Ark of the Covenant, forged by Almaïr. It reads: 'Verse 1. And upon prayers borne from the Westmost Shrine shall a new shadow form, of a place where Those Above and Those Below are joined, and the Word of God shall hold the First of the Elamais in everlasting sleep there.'
A map of an island covered in odd flora that some thought had never existed — but with this you know otherwise!
The egg of a bird beyond the realms of probability. Perhaps if nestled among flames, it will hatch.
The many and overflowing treasures of a realm none believed to exist. Clearly they were not hardy enough adventurers!
Carved from the living rock of Kidusi Anitoni, when the priests embraced hibiscus back in the 4th century.
One of the most important Deltan deities, the falcon god of the sky, from whom all great leaders were born.
A fortress home to Enbesan emperors in times gone by, most notably in its later years Surya, the mad sun-king.
Masu Masu's Tambacto city plan. A great mosque, and the world's first university are just a taste of its wonders.
A representation of the god of death and mummification in the Delta. Better hope your heart is light as a feather...
The holiest book on the shelves of the houses of the holy in the Holy City. Safe to say, it's divine.
A ritual drinking vessel found in an ancient labyrinth, carved from a single block of black steatite.
Ancient West Enbesan towns had vast mud walls, covered in carvings with scenes of daily life.
The greatest of atlas charts, commissioned by Masu Masu. His, the richest empire ever known, was at its heart.
This gold bead was one of the most opulent souvenirs bought by Masu Masu on his pilgrimage to the Holy City.
Stelae built by the ancients of Aksum to mark burial grounds. This one was the last and the tallest of them all.
The function this figure served is unknown, but for an Iron Age piece, the craftsmanship is remarkable.
Reflects the degree to which women are treasured for their fecundity, but also as seers and guardians of the spirit.
A symbol of Enbesa and its Emperor, as well as a title given to the descendants of King Selamawi.
An ancient book retelling the story of Queen Shaba's pilgrimage to Enbesa, in which she bore the magnificent Ark.
Strands of raffia still cling to the crevices of this wooden animal used in dances.
A deathly painted visage reminds the living how fortunate they are still to be.
Astral crescents studded with smoky quartz, and chrysoprastic swirls.
To The Land Of Lions! Trade
Cattle have even worn such jewellery themselves, such is the reverence held for their kind.
Diceros bicornis. At least keeping one of these beauties in a zoo will save one of their species from the poachers.
Loxodonta africana. Her intelligence cannot be understated, nor the joy she expresses unfurling her trunk.
Panthera Leo. There is a majesty and gentleness in those eyes, from which all may take courage.
Giraffa camelopardalis. Gets a decent view of the savannah from up there, and all the juiciest leaves.
Acinonyx jubatus. It is said Selamawi tamed one and adorned it with a bejewelled collar, but it ran away.
Theropithecus gelada. All the little scandals being nattered around their society will make your heart bleed.
Hippopotamus amphibius. See that mouthspan? The fat, splintered yellow teeth? Yeah, don't even think about it.
Gypaetus barbatus. Often seen suckling bone marrow, turning its beak up at meat.
Caracal caracal. Tamed for hunting by Queen Nafir when she ruled the upper crocodile delta.
Aepyceros melampus. Stott and pronk themselves into the air something chronic.

Waha Desher:
Wild Animals I Have Known
Connochaetes taurinus. Let them stampede into your life, or leave them to the lions — your choice.
Crocuta crocuta. A real laugh to hang out with.
Oryx beisa. Known to prong the odd lion with those dagger-like antennae.
Tragelaphus buxtoni. Lofty and noble, white marks and chevrons contrast against their brown fur.
Balearica regulorum. Once existed in the Old World too, but Earth cooled, and only those in warmer regions survived.
Naja ashei. Only try to handle if you have spit-proof spectacles close by!
Pandinus imperator. Imperious indeed — with a tail so fat it delivers more stab than sting.
Otocyon megalotis. They use their large ears and tail to make points of argument.
Vulpes zerda. Finicky eater — only skippy jerboas will do.
Lycaon pictus. Not as prominent in the folklore of Enbesa, but better respected in local hunter-gatherer societies.
Equus grevyi. The largest wild horse, and also very much the stripiest.
Trioceros balebicornutus. Found, with a lot of luck, deep in the Harenna forest, in Enbesa's Misty Mountains.
Canis simensis. An early account of this canid, endemic to Enbesa, states that they "leap so high, it's like they have wings".
Camelus dromedarius. The only mount that can withstand epic journeys through the desert.
Brachypelma albopilosum. A big ol' hairy spider.
Struthio camelus. Their feathers have become prized among the elite... and their spring-cleaning servants.
Phoenicopterus roseus. The pinkish tone to their feathers comes from eating lots of carotene-rich shrimp.
Atelerix albiventris. Rolls into a tiny spiky ball to protect its vulnerable parts.
Achatina fulica. Tempting to keep as an exotic pet, but this invasive species needs a lot of looking after.
A meticulous replica of the real HMS Hades, which along with HMS Styx, was wrecked during the Faithful expedition.
A paleontologist's dream. A bit mangled after thousands of years in ice, but still partially furred and fleshed!
This frozen wolf pup is 50,000 years old, predating the emergence of the domestic dog by at least 10,000 years!
A well-dressed Inuit mummy that's over 400 years old. Freeze dried, she looks as if she could have died yesterday.
Traditional Inuit dwellings built with blocks of ice acting as insulation, trapping the body heat of the people within.
An assortment of seemingly worthless miscellaneous items that belonged to the crew of the lost expedition.
A miniature children's version of the traditional Inuit sled, complete with gruff husky.
This pyramidal inuksuk was built to mark a cache of caribou meat that had been stored for the winter.
Oftentimes confused with the simpler inuksuks, this stone structure resembles a human with wide open arms.
This small pre-Thule carving was recovered in exceedingly good condition.
Monodon monoceros. The imposing spiral tusks that protrude from their jaws have been harvested and sold as unicorn horns since ancient times.
Pinguinus impennis. A very rare bird these days, perhaps because their eggs are so highly prized. Aukward.
Odobenus rosmarus. Its vibrissae — the stiff bristles around its tusks — give the walrus a whiskered appearance.
Ursus maritimus. Nanuk. A hypercarnivore adapted to the Arctic, who navigates sea ice in search of seals.
Rangifer tarandus. The largest of the caribou, this forest-dwelling species is extremely sensitive to human disturbance of their habitat.
Ovibos moschatus. Musk ox males emit a strong odor during the seasonal rut, hence the name.
Canis lupus arctos. Born an ashen grey, its coat turns white as it matures.
Pusa hispida. This small, earless seal is one of the pillars of life in the Arctic — known as nattiq by the Inuit.
Vulpes lagopus. Its snow-white fur keeps it warm — and nearly undetectable to the untrained eye.
Pagophila eburnea. This small polar gull has many vocalizations, including a warbling fox-call to warn about predators.
This piece takes one back to the times when the first Old World explorers arrived on the shores of the New World, and discovered its many wonders.
This old song sparks memories of south-eastern spices and a never-quite-forgotten fascination with the vibrant cultures of those parts of the world.
A piece composed for a speculative future, covered in snow, in which humans have to endure life on the harsh poles of the Earth and colonise the moon.
This melody evokes a world swallowed by the ocean in retaliation for humankind's abuse and floods the audience with a gentle urge to care for the environment.
The song of the century! One of countless progress and discoveries, but also one preocuppied with exploring and embracing the past.
Starts a quest to find a sunken treasure.

Isabel, dear child. You have grown so much since first I met you — the ferocious jaguar cub that you were. You had lost a brother, and I, a father. I still had the years on my side back then, and the bounce of a freed man in my step. But I owe it to you to tell you, the price I paid for that freedom was a high one. I never found the courage to tell you before now, but as the ever-quickening spectre of death approaches, I believe it is time.
You always knew I had to be a runaway slave. Well, in order to escape the plantation, I had to kill a man. The one holding the whip. That man was your brother. I had to kill him to set us all free — a decision I have had to live with ever since, though I have to say, at the time I never saw it as a choice. I know I came to you soon after, bearing the gift he intended for you, your name and his on the label, and I told you the lie that he'd died fighting in the resistance. I said he'd fought bravely against La Corona. The truth is, he was just a kid who'd fallen into the slave trade like so many others.

Well, that's all I can say, really. May you find it within yourself to forgive me for depriving you of your only brother. Either way, I shall continue to support you until I draw my last breath.

Yours, as ever,

Mr. George Smith.

A small collection of plants surviving in the arid mountains of the New World. The plants of the Andes have strong powers of water retention. Studying them may help your people to perfect agricultural processes.
The most common plants found in the icy north. Studying boreal flora may help your people better understand forest biomes.
Every time passive trade happens at the trading post, there is a chance of gaining 5t of Coffee Beans, Cocoa, Plantains, Pearls, Felt, Bread, Grapes, Chocolate.
The divine and revered plants of eastern jungles. This sanctuary of sacred plants from afar may attract pilgrims who'll want to make offerings to these living deities.
Plants both beautiful and demure from the Near East. The wild, understated beauty of this display may provoke your people to have dreams of the exotic.
Some plants commonly found in marshes. Marsh plants can be poisonous and house mosquitoes and other creatures humans consider pests. Your people may begin to take more care in regard to hygiene.
The calypso palms and bright corals of the westward isles. Visitors will enjoy tranquil walks in the azure seascape, hardly noticing the time pass. It may convince them to holiday for longer.
A collection of gigantic, colourful and sometimes edible plants that originated in the New World. This eclectic collection may stimulate an interest in fruit production among your people.
From cubs to mastodons, all are powerless against the Arctic's freezing temperatures. Ice has preserved the pieces of this exhibition in a near-perfect state.
A greater insight into the Inuit and pre-Inuit cultures that inspires a sense of wonder and civic peace. An eye-opening exhibition that breaches the distance between two very different people.

Remnants of the day two vast empires clashed at the cape of Trelawney. Each sunken object a cenotaph to those who died on both sides; the servants of patriotism and duty, bound eternally with the sea. Reminders of the glory days may boost your own citizens' patriotism, even in the harshest times.

So, the stories were true! After all, what else could possibly explain these drowned memories of a forgotten time - fragments of those who lived on that great continent that once lay beyond the narrow strait. As the (highly questionable) origin of earthly civilisation, knowledge gathered from atlantean ruins may help your archaeologists determine the location of other lost cities.
The remains of a protohistorical civilization, known for its circles of stones and enchanted forests. Your quarries and forests will reflect their inherent beauty to the initiated visitors.

The most important geological discoveries, teaching your visitors about origins of history and life. While serving as open university, your museum's exhibition may also reduce the church's attendance for good.
Mythological remains of the northern culture spreading fear and destruction for centuries on the Old World's coasts. Their passion for war and fear of nothing may inspire your fighters.
Every time passive trade happens at the trading post, there is a chance of gaining 5t of Gold Ore, Gold, Jewellery.

The colossal ruins of the abandoned stone cities hidden below the New World's jungle canopy, where the legendary El Dorado should still stand. Learning more about this civilization may help discovering the Golden City.
The admirable religious architecture and mythological parchments left by the ancient cities of the Aegean. Your people will want to play their famous tragedies in theatres.
The soul of formerly knowned terrors of the seas, stealing everything on their way. A new spirit of piracy will inhabit your sailors.
The first steps of our ancestors through the wildlands of the prehistoric era displayed to the public. Brings back basic knowledge of resources gathering for survival.
The dreadful funerary remains of a mysterious civilization from the New World, brought to your visitors. A got-to destination for any leading figure fond of esotericism.
The display of the splendors of the ancient empire, well known for building magnificent cities and infrastructure. Gathering their remains will inspire safer architecture against higher taxes.
The Arctic tundra reminds your visitors of the challenging conditions those lost on Arctic expeditions have had to endure, a popular hot — or rather, very cold — topic at the moment.

The great white desert of the far North overflows with noble fauna of immaculate fur and feathers. The sight of these creatures from the terra incognita will encourage more people to make exploration their vocation.

Fireflies of the deep, these bizarre organisms bioluminesce with such variety that those unacquainted with their existence are likely to be left feeling dazzled. The discovery and understanding of their luminescence can encourage your people to better beautify their interiors.

Trench-scudding monstrosities of nightmare, these freakish denizens of the deep, formerly believed to have "accidentally fallen from the surface", will provoke gasps of horror and fascination from the public, while enriching your scientists' knowledge about the fauna of the abysses.
Depigmentation, mutation or natural adaptation — what does it matter? These powder-white ghosts are a rare and wondrous sight when by chance they descend on a heavenly cloud.
The variety of animals living along the Great Reef Barrier is a source of knowledge and admiration for the children witnessing also dolphins shows.
These farm animals bring nothing new to discover to your visitors, but for sure enables your people to learn more about domestic animal care and reproduction.

Every time passive trade happens at the trading post, there is a chance of gaining 5t of Coffee Beans, Sugar Cane, Tobacco, Cotton, Cocoa, Caoutchouc, Plantains, Pearls, Chocolate, Coffee, Fried Plantains, Tortillas, Sugar.

The exotic fauna endemic to the oriental rainforest, traveled through for ages by merchants of the Silk and Incense Roads. The display of this specific biome will attract rich visitors from afar, leaving some exotic products in your harbor.

Originating from the Amazon Basin, these animals from the tropical rainforest show a panel of vivid colors in their fur, feathers and skin which has no equivalent in the Old World. The decoration taste in your city will directly be impacted by this natural artistic show.

The demons from the abysses, the legendary killers in the sea that you never want to face out of their fishtank. Bringing these killers into your zoo teaches your people about escaping sharks attacks and about general submarine animal behaviour.
Mythical creatures brought back to the world of reality. The true existence of these monsters will for sure inspire creative writers in your city.

Majestic creatures from the taiga, usually hiding in the cold northern coniferous forests around the globe. The sight of animals surviving in harsh climatic conditions encourages your people to show temperance in their own food consumption.

Brought back from the New World's mountains, these animals showed adaptation to life in the highlands, which made the alpaca a very reliable pack carrier. Farmers and Jornaleros can easily take advantage of these agile animals for their daily work.
Every time passive trade happens at the trading post, there is a chance of gaining 5t of Gold, Jewellery.
The legacy of the richest ever, Masu Masu, whose unfathomable wealth built extraordinary mosques, universities and libraries.
A collection of artefacts and ruins closely tied to the roots of Enbesa, rife with lions, and the smouldering seal of the past.
A miscellany of artefacts gathered from little-known cultures of the southern continent, offering insight into the daily lives of these peoples.
The river worshippers of the reed-verged Delta bequeath us rare antiquities: mysteries in stone, old gods, and death's umbral treasures.
Under the miombo's tranquil canopies and through its hidden groves, herbivores vast and thick of hide munch in secret triumph.
The delicate balance between each species' coexistence in the savannah may seem cruel, but that is why it prevails.
The diverse and unique fauna of the Enbesan plateau is one of the country's many riches, and differs starkly from that of the world below.
Different species gather to graze and drink around these lakes, so full of life. Some even fly around half the world to be here for the start of the season.
A collection of creatures, adapted to the scorching sands and scarcity of moisture in the unending desert.

A fascinating collection of plants with darkly mysterious properties. The rediscovery of these witchy plants, and their use by humans, may rejuvenate the production of more socially acceptable vices in the city.

The essential plants of medicinal gardens, as grown by monks in past times. Traditional medicinal plants have value even in a time of rapid scientific disovery. Studying them may turn up new cures and help people recover faster.
What's better than a bit of official mayhem once a year? Masked and fancy-dressed, your citizens can forget themselves and really cut loose!
Your population have rarely showed as much faith in their esteemed leader as today! They express their patriotism in honour of your great accomplishments.
The cultural heart of your city is throbbing! Theatrical, musical, and literary events have gripped the place, to the great delight of your visitors!
This festival of music, feasting and dancing celebrates the abundant harvest and the life-giving power of the fields.
The Elders of Enbesa deem this the holiest of all festivals in the calendar year, and they certainly let others know it!
This traditional festival manifests in a magnificent feast for your citizens, celebrating a bounteous end to the harvest!
The most gleefully-anticipated festival! The beer flows freely, and joy and good humour follow! Some like to call it Oktoberfest!
In the Festival of Reason, anarchists come together to celebrate truth, liberty, community and the abolition of governments.
Named after the god-like mother of trade, once an inhabitant of Angereb, this festival has everyone hustling and bustling to market!

The Cordillera park in your zoo inspires your Farmers and Jornaleros to take advantage of alpacas for their daily work.
The Boreal forest Park in your zoo encourages your people to show temperance in their own food consumption.
The Extinct Species Park in your zoo inspires creative writers in your city. They will regularly ask for your help.
The Ocean Predators Park in your zoo teaches your people a lot about general submarine animal behaviour.
The Amazon Basin Park animals in your zoo inspire new colorful decorative pattern in your city.
The Bengal Jungle Park in your zoo attracts rich merchants from afar.
The Farm Animal Park teaches more arbout domestic animal care and reproduction to your people.
The Great Barrier Reef Park in your zoo teaches everything to the children and increases the happiness of workers and artisans.
The Albino Park encourages many more visitors, keen to donate and preserve these pale peculiarities.
The Abyssal Depths Park delivered precious knowledge about the long-unknown deep abysses and their fauna. Your zoological searches during diving sessions now have a greater chance of success.
The Luminaries Park in your zoo inspires your people to use better lighting at their venues, resulting in astonishing phosphorescent displays for the viewing pleasure of their customers.
The Great North Park in your zoo promotes vocations of exploration among your people.
The Arctic Tundra Park attracts plenty of curious visitors, eager to learn more about the conditions those lost in the Arctic have had to endure.
The Eagle Empire Exhibition in your museum inspires your people to build safer architecture and convinces them to pay higher taxes.
The Andes Tomb exhibition in your museum attracts many leading figures fond of esotericism to your city.
The Skull and Bones exhibition in your museum converted all your sailors into piracy.
The Mankind Origins exhibition in your museum reminds your people ancestral knowledge for resources gathering.
The Aegean Culture exhibition in your museum promoted litterature in your theatres, that now play ancient tragedies with an high attractiveness.
The Lost Cities exhibition in your museum contains some sources about the legendary El Dorado. Merchants will regularly bring gold from the legendary city.
The Northern Sagas exhibition in your museum inspires your people with a warring spirit empowering your military.
The Jurassic World exhibition in your museum destroys the theory of creationism in favour of evolution theory, taught life-sized.
The Megaliths Spirit exhibition reminds the beauty of natural landscapes like quarries and forests to your people and visitors.

The Atlantis Exhibition has been studied by your historians; the cryptic messages and shapes of the lost civilization spawning theories about other lost cities. Your archaeological searches during diving sessions now have a greater chance of success.
The Battle of Trelawney exhibition fills your people with a deep sense of patriotism, defending their nation during naval battles whatever the cost.
Inspired by the Thule Relics Exhibition, your people become more curious and respectful of the Arctic and everything related to it.
In awe at the perfect state of conservation of the Icebound Exhibition, your food and drinks producers have learned a thing or two about preservation.
By studying the Amazon Garden, your people are now able to seed their own local plantations of fruit trees that were previously impossible to grow.
Visitors exploring your Sargasso Sea Garden now have an overwhelming thirst for vacation and island life. Some of them will stay forever.
By observing the stagnant ponds of your Marshland Garden, your people have become acutely aware of the need for a proper water treatment system. Your overall city illness risk has decreased.
Inspired by the Near East Garden, your people have decided to adopt some Near East culture in their daily life. They can now develop and expand the production of spices.
Pilgrims are arriving from everywhere to experience the meditative splendour of your Sacred Garden, leaving offerings behind when they leave.

Learning more about northern forests in your Subalpine Garden has taught your people more about forest biomes, extending their knowledge of arboriculture and increasing their ability to hunt in those environments.
Studying your rocky Andean Garden has taught your people how to help different plants grow, flourish and expand, even during droughts.
Studying your Herb Garden has enabled your doctors and chemists to develop new cures, letting them heal your people faster.

While they may find the properties of the plants in the Enchanted Garden a little too far out, your people have been inspired to improve and refine production of more traditional plant-based stimulants.
Disseminates anarchist propaganda amongst your enemy's population, encouraging riots.
area of influence for all Public Buildings
"I will not, gentlemen, stand for an initiative that would have us serve offal at banquets like common continentals!"
"...all who move that the lower snooker rooms and second sherry cellar be repurposed for storage, say 'aye'!"
"What are a few exploding mice on our bankroll to the enthusiasms of youth and the might of science?"
"And so it is decreed: all offices of this institution shall benefit from technology and consultants befitting of their pursuits."
"My point, sir, is that you would not so readily gild every ruddy frontispiece as you would this town hall, if you did not stand to profit from it!"
"If the Enbesa delegation to the Fair is to receive additional acres, it is only right that the offer should be extended to all."
"Our mandate lies with our people's right to education and culture. The motion to display infinitely more cabinets of curiosities passes!"
"It is within our remit to ensure all species - aye, even trout! - be given fit diet, and the space and habitat to roam!"
"I moot that a national stipend be provided to all estates willing to host a tour of their wondrous collections. All in favour?"
Superior specialists replace the regular ones visiting your city.
"Jeer all you will, milords, but remember who built your lofty palaces. In fact, our economy craves more talented foreigners!"
"If the lords would only allow their land to be better used, we might see a surge in domestic product!"
"Skilled labour is the cornerstone upon which our great nation is built, and with these provisions, it shall soon bear fruit!"
"The efficient running of individual factories must be of interest to us, if we truly wish to see the economic boom so often promised."
"We know too well, professor, what abhorrent purpose drives your support of this bill. Such bolts of power are not man's to hurl!"
"Having imprisoned two of their leaders only last week, we need to make more allowances if we want to placate the unions!"
"Now is not the time for thrift! There is money to be found in our people's pockets - we need but coax it out of them!"
"Lord Alfred's 'Waltz of the Light Brigade' will make for a perfect centrepiece to the program - they will throng to the theatres!"
"All in agreement that galvanic sheathing should be at, but not in excess of nine thousand units, say 'aye'."
"I have a dream, milords - a dream that one day our peoples will rise up in the nurture of our care! A dream of freedom!"
"They'll drink themselves deaf anyway - at least let them do so away from the eyes of proper society!"
"Gentlemen, I would remind you of the fate of Innsmouth. Would you strangle efficiency, and have this city suffer similar sordor?"
"Oh come now, they stink so much already they can hardly complain of a few additional tons of fish crammed into storage!"
"That our oil stores are stretched is grave news indeed. Unless we pass this bill, I fear we'll have to resort to tossing dissenters into the sea."
"All eyes turned to our ports, and yet you would block an extension of the docklands? A lesser man would doubt your allegiance, sir!"
"Think of them as ants, my lord. Minute, devoted ants, single-mindedly attending to ships for the city's profit - and our own."
Allows you to build one Scholar Residence.
Proof that life will prevail— however harsh the climate— in the nooks and crevices of the scorching Enbesan sands.
Migratory birds have found your zoological haven and, rightly or wrongly, have designated your island as one of the stops on their migration cycle.
The animals of the Enbesan Highlands hearten those far away from home — even if the beasts do miss the tastes and sights of their homeland.
The savannah, where species coexist in a delicate balance in a race to survive, inspires your farmers to improve the grazing areas for their animals.
The woodlands of the southern continent have a wild appeal, and your people have begun to appreciate the vegetation of your island more.
The people of the Delta, founders of bureaucracy and advocates of weighing scales, set an inspiring standard for your administration.
Knowledge of the Lost Tribes, who thrive in harsher environments and exist on far less, teaches your people how to live more self-sufficient, natural lives.
The rich and storied history of Enbesa reminds the scholars of the brilliant founders of their institution, and inspires them in their academic endeavours.
The unfathomable wealth of Masu Masu reminds traders that money is to be spent on whatever brings them happiness, even if it's just a souvenir.

"For too long, our harbours have been run without even a semblance of order — but no longer!"
